revised_title: The Law of Fatigue and its Implications in Animal Mechanics
tldr: This article discusses the law of fatigue, which states that when a muscle is in constant action until it becomes fatigued, the total work done multiplied by the rate of work remains constant. The author conducts experiments with medical students to test this law and provides evidence supporting its validity. The findings have implications for understanding muscle physiology and animal mechanics.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
